Awaay ko kaka^ ako to fa'inayan.

Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: Makomod kiso ato akong ato ama: a moko^ hay?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?

S.FORM: Caay. Caay ka komod kako ato caira a moko^.
S.TRANSL: 不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn't live with them.

Makomod kako aci mama^ aci ina^ aci kaka^.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.

S.FORM: Nani cowa^ kiso?
Nani Kalingko^ kako.
Icowa ko loma' no miso?
I Fata'an ko loma' no niyam.
S.TRANSL: Our home is in Matthew Saddle.

S.FORM: Icowa^ ko nalacolan no miso?
I Fata'an ko nalacolan no mako.
S.TRANSL: My hometown is in Matthew Ann.

S.FORM: Icowa^ ko niyaro' no miso?
I Fata'an ko niyaro' ako.
S.TRANSL: Our tribe is in Matthew's Saddle.

S.FORM: Anohacowa^ kiso a taloma' i niyaro'?
S.TRANSL: 你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: I pipahanhanan no lalood kako a taloma'.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.

S.FORM: O wawa no Pangcah kako.

Macidal anini^, faedet ko romi'ad.
S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.

S.FORM: Sienaw i papotal hay?
S.TRANSL: Is it going to be cold outside?

S.FORM: Sienaw, adihayen ka cifodoy.
S.TRANSL: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: Matohem i papotal hay?
Caay, mafali^ to. Saepi'.
Masamaan ko romi'ad anini^?
Diheko^ anini^. Caay ka sienaw, caay ka faedet.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: Masamaan ko romi'ad anini^ a dadaya^?
Awaay ko kotem, masadak to ko fo'is.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: Masamaan ko romi'ad i papotal?
Salaw saho^ ko 'orad, masadak to ko cidal, ira ko talakal ni Idek.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

S.FORM: Masamaan ko romi'ad i tamowanan?
S.TRANSL: What's the weather like where you are?

S.FORM: Tata'ak ko fali^ itini.
S.TRANSL: We're going to have a big storm here.

S.FORM: Fangcal ko romi'ad itira i tamowanan hay?
Fangcal ko romi'ad, tata'ak ko cidal.
S.TRANSL: Very well, out of the big sun.

S.FORM: Talapicodadan to kako.
S.TRANSL: I have to go to school.

S.FORM: Sienaw ko romi'ad, adihayen ko kacifodoy.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: Masadak to kako.
Mama'orad anohoni kacicacelakan.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: Mama'orad hay?
Mafotili' i honi, o mama'orad anohoni.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

S.FORM: Ma'orad to hay?
Ma'orad i honi, nika masalaw to imatini.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

S.FORM: Ma'orad to hay?

S.FORM: Ma'orad i papotal, mapawan kako a cicacelakan.

It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: Nga'ay ho^ kiso?

S.FORM: Mamaan kiso?

The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

S.FORM: Mapawan kako mihakiwid to impic ako.

S.FORM: Hay, o sasisit ko roma^.

S.TRANSL: 你搭捷運來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?

S.TRANSL: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

Ciotofay kiso hay?
Hay, ira ko otofay ako.
Ira ko otofay iso hay?
Awaay ko otofay ako.

Manga'ay to.
Manga'ay kako palicay i tisowanan haw?

Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?

S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll wait for you at home.

S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於阿美族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I would like to ask you about the legends of the Amis.

S.FORM: Awaay kako i loma'. Talalotok kako.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won't be home.

S.FORM: O nikatengil ako, mataneng ko fana' iso to rayray no Pangcah, saka mangalay kako a mitengil i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對阿美族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you know a lot about the traditional customs of the Amis and I would like to ask you something.

S.FORM: Caay ka talolong ko fana' ako, nika sa'icel hato ako a paca'of.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: Manga'ay kako a misya-sing haw? O sakacaloway a mikilok i ikor.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: Nga'ay to.
Pina^ to ko mihecaan iso anini^?
Siwa^ to a polo' ira ko falo^.
Masakapah ho^ kiso.
Cowa^ sa, mato'as to!
Nani cowa^ kiso a tayni?
Nani Fata'an kako.
O Pangcah ko fafahi^ iso haw?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是阿美族人嗎?

S.FORM: Caay, o Piwma^ ciira.
Pina^ a sasowalan ko kafana' iso?
Mafana' kako a somowal to sowal no Pangcah ato no Piwma^.
S.TRANSL: 我會說阿美語和卑南語。

S.FORM: Lipahak kako anini^ a palicay i tisowanan. Painien ho kako to pakayniay i paysin to pi'adop haw?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: Hay, mararid kako a talalotok yo o kapah ho.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: Aray ko pipaini iso anini^ a romi'ad.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: O so'elinay ko nipaini no mako, o nano rayray a nipaini no to'as.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: Hatini aca^ ko pipalicay ako anini^. Aray!
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: Hay!

S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?

Aray!

S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

No, this is already very cheap.

$30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?

S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

You can tell me what else you want to read.

It's okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: Anohacowa^ kiso a panokas toya payso^ i takowanan?

S.FORM: Anocila^.

Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from Kacaw?

S.FORM: Caay, o nicakayan ni ina^.
S.TRANSL: No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: Hay, tayra kako.

S.TRANSL: Go and ask Panay to return the money.

S.TRANSL: How much does she owe you?

S.TRANSL: I'm going to plant vegetables in the garden.

There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

S.TRANSL: How many younger siblings do you have?

S.TRANSL: How many older siblings do you have?

S.TRANSL: I don't have any older siblings.

S.TRANSL: How many siblings do you have?

Hay, o Yin-cu-min kami.
O Pangca:h ciira hay?
Hay, o Pangca:h ciira.
S.TRANSL: 是的， 她也是阿美族人。

S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?

S.FORM: Pakahikoki^ kako a talaPeng-fu.

S.FORM: Pakamaan kiso a talaPeng-fu?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: Pakalonan kako a talaPeng-fu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: Pakamaan kiso a taloma'?
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.TRANSL: How does Panay go to school?

S.TRANSL: Panay goes to school by train.

S.TRANSL: How does Kacaw go to church?

S.FORM: Pakacitingsya^ ci Kacaw a talakiwkay.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw goes to church by bicycle.

S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.

S.FORM: Pakacitingsya^ kiso a talapicodadan hay?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: Pakafaso^ iri pakapaliding kiso a talakiwkay?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: Maraay ko patiyamay nani loma' namo hay?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.TRANSL: Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.TRANSL: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

S.TRANSL: I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: Nga:lay sa kako a pakanengneng.
S.TRANSL: I want to see them right away.

S.FORM: Kacaw, awaay to ko epah i loma', picakayi ho^ kiso.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Kacaw, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: Ira ho^ ko cecay kofoc i sefi^, hamaanen ho^ a micakay!
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: Caay ka edeng a cecay kofoc, picakayi ho^ to tasa^ kofoc.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: Micakay kako to epah, ira itini i tamowan haw?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們這裏有賣嗎？
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: Ira to! Pinaen iso kofoc ko picakay?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: Tosa^ kofoc ato cecay pawti^ ko felac.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: Ini ko felac, mangalay ho^ to roma^ haw?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: O ta'ol ko roma^, ira itini haw?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

S.FORM: Maemin to a cakayen no tao ko ta'ol.
Micakay kako to fodoy.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: O masamanay ko han iso?
S.TRANSL: What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: O aporo'ay ko caca'edongan a fodoy.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: Maman kinian o kahengangay?
Ira ho^ ko romaay a cengel haw?
S.TRANSL: How about this red one?Do you have another color?

S.FORM: Ira ho^ ko fohecalay ato langdaway.
S.TRANSL: We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: Panenengen kako tora langdaway ari!
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服!
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Kacaw, talacowa^ kiso i honi? Miondo kiso hay?
S.TRANSL: Kacaw你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
Kacaw, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: Caay, mipatado^ kako i ci ama:an a micakay to sinafel.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: Hay sa! Cilimaw kiso anodadaya^? Malafia ho^ kita a tatosa^ ri!
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊!你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯!
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: Aya! Maanen aca^, micakay kako to fodoy.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: Ano matira, mihakelong kako i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: Nga'ay ho^! Pina^ pida^ kina sinafel?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: Cecay falod tosa^ polo' ko pida^.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: Pina^ pida^ kina fonga^?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: Cecay dadoy i, tolo^ polo' ko pida^.
S.TRANSL: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: Tosa^ falod no sinafel ato cecay dadoy no fonga^ ko picakay ako.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Kacaw, mapawan kako to sasorit ako, pacaliwen ho^ kako to no miso haw?
S.TRANSL: Kacaw，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Kacaw, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: Awaa:y ko no mako, o ni Panay kinian.
S.TRANSL: I don't have one either. This is Panay's.

S.FORM: Pacaliwen ho^ kako ri, panokasen ako anoho:ni^.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: Hayda, ini.
Aray, sowal hato ci Panay.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank Panay for me.

S.FORM: O maan to haca^?
Mamipanokas kako tonini a codad tosa^.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.

S.FORM: Hayda, o maan to haca^?
S.TRANSL: No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: Caliwen haca^ ako kina codad tolo^.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: Nga'ay to. Nika panokasen i rikor no tolo^ a romi'ad.
S.TRANSL: 好了。記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: Caay ho^ panokas kiso to sasisit ako.
S.TRANSL: You haven't returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: Mapanokas to ako inacila^ kiya.
Talacowa^ to aca^ koya sasisit ako?
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了?
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: Pacaliwen iso ci Kacaw kiya!
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to Kacaw?

S.FORM: Caay ka fana' kako. Tengilaw ho^ ako ciira.
S.TRANSL: I don't know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: Pali'ayawen ako pacaliw kiso to no mako.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Panay, o nipacaliwan ni Kacaw kora ngayto^ i tisowanan haw?
S.TRANSL: Panay, did Kacaw lend you this coat?

S.FORM: Caay, o nicakayananan ni ina^ ako.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: O malecaday kora ngayto^ ni Kacaw ato no miso haw?
S.TRANSL: Kacaw's coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: O kohetingay ko niira, caay ka lecad ko cengel no niyam.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Panay, na micaliw kiso to payso^ i ci Kacawan haw?
S.TRANSL: Panay, did you borrow money from Kacaw?

S.FORM: Hay, kona anini^ kako a panokas i ciiraan, nika mapawan kako a miala^ to payso^.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

S.FORM: Anohacowa^ to aca^ kiso a panokas?
S.TRANSL: Then, when will you return the money?

S.FORM: Panokas hato ako i ciiraan anocila^.
S.TRANSL: I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: Hay, pasowal hato ako ci Kacaw.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Kacaw for you.

S.FORM: O ta'eref ko sapilepel to 'edo^, o talakal ko sapilepel to tolok, matira ta matama^.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: Hilam haenen aca^! Moraraw ko no mako! Onini ko sakacaay pakalepel no mako.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣！我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that's why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: Pasifana'aw haca^ ako kiso a misanga' to matiniay a tosa^ a tilo^.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: Hay, aray! Matira i, mamanga'ay to kako a milepel to 'a'adopen.
S.TRANSL: 好啊，太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: Takaraw to ko semot no omah, Oli! Alaen ho^ ko kawkaw i 'ariri^, talaomah kita.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let's go to the fields.

S.FORM: Icowa^ a mateli^ koya kawkaw?
I tatihi^ no fasolan, micomod kiso to 'ariri^ i, mamaneneng iso.
S.TRANSL: 在圓簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: Na'onen, matafala. Matalem kora kawkaw.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don't get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: Aka piripa' to tilo^ ako yo!
Icowa^ koya tilo^ no miso?
I kalaeno^ nora kilang ko tilo^ no mako.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: Nawiro maharate:ng ho^ iso?
Ira ko nipatokawan no mako itini, ora ko sakafan' ako to tilo^ no mako.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: O rakar kinian, telien i 'alo^, o sapilepel to foting.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊用來捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: Awaay ko rakar i tamiyanan, o tiked ko sapilepel niyam to foting.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don't have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: Caay ka fana' kako a mipatiked, pasifana' hato kako haw?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: Nga'ay to! Malahakelong kita a mipatiked anoci:la^.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let's go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: Ano cilimaw, pasifana'en ako kiso a misanga' to rakar.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: Mangangi^ ko tiked iso, alatek cimaalaay a foting! Tengtengen ari!
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來!
I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: Talaen ho^! Tada tata'ak ko nikangangi^ no lonan. Itini kako a mitengteng to tiked, katayra ho^ kiso iti:raw a miala^ to salil.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: Tata! Taloma' to kita, palada'en ita ko 'alomanay.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let's go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: Tayni^ to ko singsi^.
Aka to pisalama^, kamaro' to i kamaro'an.
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: Maanen aca, maapac to kako!
Katahenay a talaloma'.
Saka pina to no lipay i anini?
Tinomaan i anini, o pipahanhan anocila^, mafolodaw kita a misalama^!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It's Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let's go out and play together!

S.FORM: hayda! talalawac no 'alo^ kita.
S.TRANSL: Great! Let's go to the riverside.

S.FORM: Saka pina no lipay i anocila^?
S.TRANSL: What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: Tinoloan i anocila^, misalamaaaw kita to mali^ i herek no lahok anocila^.
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧。
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let's go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: Nimaan kiso anodafak?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: Tinopangan i anocila^, talakiyukay kako ato ci ina^.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: Mamaan kiso?
Mangalay kako a mota',talakamisi'an ho kako.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: Masinawar kako.
Tihemoken a pahanhan kiso.
Singsi^, adada^ ko tiyad ako, talakatomayi'an ho kako.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，我要先去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: Hayda, katahenay.
Manga'ay kako a monanaw haw?
S.TRANSL: May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: Mangata^ to mipahanhan, nahoni to a tayra.
S.TRANSL: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: Singsi^, adada^ ko tangal ako, mihifang kako i herek no lahok.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: Hay, na'onen a taloma'.
S.TRANSL: Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: Singsi^, mihifang kako i anocilaay a tinocayan, mipaising kako.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: Hayda, na'onen ko tireng.
Icowa^ ci Panay?
Adada^ ko tiyad niira, i katomayi'an ciira.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She's in the restroom.

S.FORM: Icowa^ ci Kacaw?
Singsi^, adada^ ko pi'elokan ni Kacaw, mihifang ciira anini^.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Kacaw has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: Nawiro awaay a tayni^ ci Panay?
Malalisan ciira.
Painien ho ko tireng.
Ci Namoh Kolas han ko ngangan no mako, moetepay to ko mihecaan i matini^.
S.TRANSL: My name is Namoh Kolas, and I'm 10 years old.

S.FORM: Cima han ko ngangan no miso?
Ci Foting Kolas han kako.
O wawa^ no icowaay a finacadan kiso?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: O wawa^ no Pangcah kako.
O Pangcah a ma'emin ko laloma'an no miso haw?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: Hay, O Pangcah a ma'emin ko laloma'an no niyam.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是阿美族人。
Yes, my whole family is Amis.

S.FORM: O Pangcah a ma'emin ko laloma'an no miso haw?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: Caay, o Pangcah ci mama^ no mako, o tay-wan ci ina^ no mako.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是阿美族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Amis, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: O wawa^ nima^ kiso?
O wawa^ ni Mayaw Looh kako.
O mama^ no miso kiraan haw? pinaay to ko mihecaan niira?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: Enem polo' to ko mihecaan niira.
O mama^ no miso kiraan haw? pinaay to ko mihecaan niira?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: Cai, o kalas no niyaro' niyam ciira, falo^ polo' to ko mihecaan niira.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: Pina^ to ko mihecaan no fa'inayan a kaka^ no miso?
Safawfalo^ to ko mihecaan no fa'inayan a kaka^ no mako.
Pina^ ko la'ed no mihecaan no namo?
S.TRANSL: Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: Lima^ ko la'ed no mihecaan no niyam.
Hacowa^ katakaraw kiso?
Cecay li'an ira ko sepat polo' ko takaraw ako.
Halafin to caay ka saso'araw, mati:ya^ takaraway to kiso?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你好像長高了?
I haven't seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: Hay, cecay li'an ira ko tolo^ polo' a kung-fen to ko takaraw ako.
Masoeso^ to kiso haw?
Cowa^, moraraw pinengneng iso.
Makori^ to kiso haw?
Cowa^, masoeso^ to kako.
Masoeso^ to kiso haw?
Hay, tolo^ polo' to ko dadoy ako i matini^.
Talacowa^ kiso?
Talakatayalan kako a mikilim to singsi^.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to the office to see the teacher.

S.FORM: Talacowa^ ci Kacaw?
Mifalah to lakaw ciira.
S.TRANSL: He's going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: Icowa^ ci Kacaw?
I pidangoyan ciira, milifet to no midangoyay ciira anohoni^.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He's at the swimming pool. He's going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: Icowa^ ci Panay? milifet to no mafekacay ciira anohoni^.
S.TRANSL: Panay在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Panay? She's going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: I pipasifana'an ciira, tahidangen ako ciira.
S.TRANSL: She's in the auditorium. I'll go call her.

S.FORM: Mafolod kita a talapiondoan.
S.TRANSL: Let's go to the playground together.

S.FORM: Micakay ho kako to sakalahok, kilim han to ako kiso anohoni^.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，我等一下去找你。
I'll go buy lunch first, and then I'll meet you later.

S.FORM: Mafolod kita a mikakoy to tafo^!
S.TRANSL: Let's carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: Kilimen iso ko tao^, mikilim kako to singsi^.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I'm going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: Milifet to no mimokonay to mali^ ci Kacaw i anini a romi'ad haw?
S.TRANSL: Is Kacaw competing in croquet today?

S.FORM: Cai, milifet to no maeferay ciira.
S.TRANSL: No, he's competing in high jump.

S.FORM: Milifet kiso i piondokayan a romi'ad haw?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: Hay, milifet to no mafekacay kako.
Milifet kiso i piondokayan a romi'ad haw?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: Milifet to no mimokonay to mali^ kako.
Nimaan kita i piondokayan a romi'ad?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?

S.FORM: Malalifet to no masasitengtengay kita.
S.TRANSL: We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: Mipacakay to kakaenen i piondokayan kita haw?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: Aka, mipacakay to mali^ kita.
Pakaala^ to sakacecay kiso, tada ka'irayan!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，真是值得炫耀！
Congratulations on getting first place! You're amazing!

S.FORM: Aray.
Ira i loma' ci ama haw?
Hay, ira i kafoti'an a mafoti' ciira.
S.TRANSL: Yes, she's sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: Ira i loma' ci ama haw?
Awaay, sadak saho, anodadaya^ to a taloma' ciira.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she's not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: Ira i loma' ci akong haw?
I sakatosa^ a tongroh ciira, kacakat kiso a mikilim.
S.TRANSL: He's upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: Ira ko i loma'ay haw?
Ci Kacaw sa, halafin to caay ka'araw kiso, nga'ay kiso haw?
S.TRANSL: 是Kacaw喔，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It's Kacaw. I haven't seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: Nga'ay to! tayniay kako a mikilim kisowan a malalicay.
S.TRANSL: I'm doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: Icowa^ ci mama^ no miso?
Mikeling to sinafel i sefi^ ciira, tahidangen ako haw.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He's in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: Talacowa^ to ci Panay?
Talatalokan ciira a milepel to 'ayam.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: Akong, taynian to kami.
Awaay i loma' ci akong, i pala^ ciira, talaen ho ko kafelec.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He's in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: Tayni^ to kiso faki^.
Halafin to caay ka'araw, sofac sato kiso.
S.TRANSL: I haven't seen you in a while. You've grown taller.

S.FORM: Lipahak ko faloco' a paka'araw a tayni^ kiso.
S.TRANSL: It's so good to see you.

S.FORM: O sapafeli^ i tamowanan kina talacay, i pin-syangen a pateli^.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here's a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: Halafin to cai ka tayni^ kiso, tahidangen ako caira tayni^ a malafi^.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃晚餐。
It's been a while. Let's have a meal together.

S.FORM: Aka pisamaamaan aca, pauciya han kako, i palafangan kita a malalicay.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I'll just have tea. Let's sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: Aray han ko pipaini^ no miso, taloma' to kako.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: Herek saho a mipacok tina 'ayam, pataloma' hato, namo hato a micacak.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你們自己帶回去煮。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: Herek no lahok kita a matatala^ i ancila^ haw?
S.TRANSL: Sera:我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: Hay, icowa^ kita a matatala^ a masaso'araw?
I picodadan kita a matatala^ haw? milu-in kita.
S.TRANSL: Sera:我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: tala soraratan aca, cilosid kako a tayraan.
S.TRANSL: Onak:那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let's go to the community center. I'll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: Makapah a macerak ko sakola no niyaro' niyam, tayni hato i kacerakan no hana^ a mikilim i takowanan!
S.TRANSL: Sera:我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: Talae:n aca i kacanglahan, tada halafin.
S.TRANSL: Onak:那要等到春天，太久了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It's too late, isn't it?

S.FORM: Ano matira, piilisinan aca a tayni kiso.
S.TRANSL: Sera:那你豐年祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Harvest Festival!

S.FORM: Hayda! mihamham kako!
S.TRANSL: Alright! I'm looking forward to it!

S.FORM: Milicay ho, hacowa kiso a malinah a tala niyaro'?
S.TRANSL: Sera:請問你何時要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

S.FORM: Malasingsi^ to kako ta taloma'.
S.TRANSL: I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: Nawiro cai ka i tokay a malasingsi^?
S.TRANSL: Sera:為甚麼不在都市當老師?
Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: Ma'ilol kako to niyaro', mangalay kako a paco'ay to niyaro' niyam.
S.TRANSL: Onak:因為我懷念我的故鄉，希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: Mafana' kiso a mitenoon, cima ko pasifana'ay kisowanan?
S.TRANSL: Onak:你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You're very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: Ci ama ako, o mafana;'ay a mitenoon ciira i niyaro' no niyam.
S.TRANSL: Sera:是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: Nawiro mangalay a minanam a mitenoon kiso?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: O serangawan no mita ko tenoon, mangalay kako a misarayray to serangawan.
S.TRANSL: Sera:織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: kaeso' 'inipen kina eraw.
Nisaerawan no mako yo!
Watah ko fana' iso, halafin a misaeraw haw?
S.TRANSL: Onak:你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You're really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: Cai, cecay a lipay maherek to , cacaken ho ko hakhak ato hemay, ta diwadiw han a mipacamol to tomod, ta fa^cal to paroen i 'atomo.
S.TRANSL: Sera:不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: O maan ko nipacakayan iso?
Ira ko daydam ato lokiyo, o nipalomaan no mako a maemin.
S.TRANSL: Kamih:我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: Ano hatosa^ han ako a micakay ri, pina^ ko 'aca^?
Tosa^ li'an ira ko lima^ polo' a mapolong.
Maolah kako kina fodoy, pina^ ko 'aca^?
S.TRANSL: Piyaw:我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: Lima^ li'an kinian.
Watah ka'atekes, keroren to mamang rey?
S.TRANSL: It's too expensive. Can't you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: Tatiih, ano keroren haca, awa ko lifon no mako.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I'll lose money.

S.FORM: Hayda, yana kohetingay a fodoy to cecay han ako.
S.TRANSL: Piyaw:好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I'll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: Nianay a po'ot ato sioy han ako.
S.TRANSL: Piyaw:我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: Tosa^ patek pida^ a mapolong, nakamayan no mako kinian, mihusyu kako caay kalales.
S.TRANSL: Kamih:總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It's a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: Painien ako ko hanghang a tayni micakay, maedeng kaemihen haca to mamang haw?
S.TRANSL: Piyaw:我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I'll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: Hayda, keroren ako to tosa^ polo' a pasintu.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I'll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: katayni a minengneng yo! ira ko nipacakayan to fodoy ato tamohong.
S.TRANSL: Piyaw:來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: Pina ko 'aca^ no fodoy?
Tolo^ li'an ira ko lima^ polo' pida^ ko cecay a fafodoyan, cecay patek pida^ ko tolo^.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: Cecayen aca^ ako a micakay, ka o faelohay ko pafelien kako.
S.TRANSL: Kamih:我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I'll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: Nga'ay ho, mangalay kako a micakay to hakhak ato siraw.
S.TRANSL: Kamih:你好，我想要買糯米飯和鹹豬肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: Ma'emin to a mapacakay ko hakhak, ira ho ko nisaepangan to tana', mangalay kiso a micakay haw?
S.TRANSL: Piyaw:糯米飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥麵包，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: Hayda^, pafelien kako to cecay, cilacila to kako a micakay to hemay.
S.TRANSL: Kamih:好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I'll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: Hayda^, padangen ako kiso a miparo^ i tisakiay, lima^ polo' pida^ a hatini.
S.TRANSL: Piyaw:好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I'll pack it in a bag for you. That'll be 50 dollars.
